author: barnabasbusa
content:
Without the EL bug we would have never discovered the CL bug (thats currently on with LH). 

Reproducing the LH bug on a local test would have been nearly impossible. LH unable to find suitable peers due to some peering constraint only came out on a large devnet. 

I think the findings of devnet 4 were super valuable. 

I still think the EL bug could/should have been caught earlier, but its also a pretty recent change in the EL clients, so it makes sense that it wasn't caught earlier.

author: cskiraly
content:
I think if there is a long debate about the correct interpretation of an EIP, it is wrong to see it as a client bug (independent of whether it is EL or CL or which clients).

What we were catching here is an ambiguity in an EIP. Do we have better tools to catch these? For parts of the EIPs yes, but not for all. Partly our test is to let many teams interpret and implement them, and see if they got to the same interpretation.
The real question to me is whether we can implement changes in the process that make it easier to find these ambiguities in the interpretations of EIPs.
